intro: Willoughbya armigera, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. It produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. Willoughbya armigera is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in dry, open habitats.
